economy.title: Economic Diversity

resources.title: Natural Resources

market.title: Regional Market

workforce.title: Skilled Workforce

infrastructure.title: Infrastructure Development

system.title: Legal System
system.content: Mixed: Civil law and common law - Constitution of 1972 revised
system.details: Cameroon has a mixed legal system, influenced by both French civil law and English common law. The Constitution of 1972, revised several times, constitutes the fundamental law.

codes.title: Important Codes
codes.content: Civil Code, Penal Code, OHADA, Investment Code
codes.details: The main legal codes include the Civil Code, the Penal Code, the uniform acts of OHADA, and the Investment Code which governs economic activities.

jurisdictions.title: Jurisdictions
jurisdictions.content: Supreme Court, Courts of Appeal, Courts of First Instance
jurisdictions.details: The judicial system includes the Supreme Court (highest jurisdiction), the Courts of Appeal, and the Courts of First Instance distributed throughout the territory.

hero.title: Legal and Fiscal Framework
hero.subtitle: Understanding the legal and fiscal context for successful investments in Cameroon.

introduction.title: Presentation of the Legal and Fiscal Framework in Cameroon
introduction.text: Cameroon, a Central African country, has a legal and fiscal framework designed to promote investments and regulate economic activities. It is a hybrid system, blending modernity and tradition, with laws adapted to the needs of local and international economic players.

legalFramework.title: Legal Framework
legalFramework.text: Cameroon has a legal system based on civil law and customary law, while integrating specificities related to its regional and historical context. The main laws include the Investment Code, the Labour Code, and the Commercial Code.

civilLaw.title: Civil Law
civilLaw.text: Inherited from the French tradition, civil law is the main foundation of the Cameroonian legal system. It is based on written texts, such as codes and laws adopted by the government.

customaryLaw.title: Customary Law
customaryLaw.text: Inspired by local traditions and customs, it coexists with civil law and is mainly used in family, inheritance, and land matters, particularly in rural communities.

investmentCode.title: The Investment Code
investmentCode.text: This code establishes the rules and incentives to encourage national and foreign investments. It offers tax advantages, customs exemptions, and a stable environment for investors.

laborCode.title: The Labour Code
laborCode.text: This text governs the relations between employers and employees. It sets the rights and obligations of both parties, such as employment conditions, remuneration, workplace safety, and conflict resolution.

commercialCode.title: The Commercial Code
commercialCode.text: It regulates commercial and industrial activities. It covers areas such as commercial contracts, companies, bankruptcy, and the settlement of commercial disputes.

landRegulation.title: Land Regulation
landRegulation.text: The land legal framework is crucial for investors wishing to acquire land. It differentiates between land belonging to the private, public, or customary domain.

firstInstanceCourts.title: Courts of First Instance
firstInstanceCourts.text: For ordinary civil, criminal, and commercial cases.

supremeCourt.title: The Supreme Court
supremeCourt.text: The highest court in the country.

administrativeTribunals.title: Administrative Tribunals
administrativeTribunals.text: For disputes involving the public administration.

legalFramework.conclusion: The country is also a member of the Organization for the Harmonization of Business Law in Africa (OHADA), which ensures the application of harmonized business law in 17 African countries.

fiscalFramework.title: Fiscal Framework
fiscalFramework.text: Cameroon has put in place a structured tax system, designed to collect the resources necessary for economic development while encouraging investments.

corporateTax.title: Corporate Income Tax (CIT)
corporateTax.text: Standard rate: 30% on profits - Foreign companies may be subject to a 15% withholding tax on their income in Cameroon.

incomeTax.title: Personal Income Tax (PIT)
incomeTax.text: Progressive, with rates ranging from 11% to 38%, depending on the income level.

vat.title: Value Added Tax (VAT)
vat.text: Standard rate: 19.25% - Possible exemptions for certain goods and services, particularly those related to priority sectors such as agriculture and education.

customsDuties.title: Customs Duties
customsDuties.text: Customs duties vary depending on the imported products, with preferential rates for imports from certain countries or regional blocs such as CEMAC (Economic and Monetary Community of Central Africa).

otherTaxes.title: Other Taxes
otherTaxes.text: Tax on Economic Activities (TAE), Property Tax, Excise Duties on certain products (alcohol, tobacco, fuel).

investmentCode.title: The Investment Code
investmentCode.text: Temporary exemptions from corporate income tax for new companies.

bilateralAgreements.title: Bilateral Agreements
bilateralAgreements.text: Reduction of customs duties for the import of industrial equipment.

sectoralIncentives.title: Sectoral Incentives
sectoralIncentives.text: VAT exemptions for certain priority sectors such as agriculture or renewable energies.

fiscalFramework.conclusion: The tax administration is supervised by the Directorate General of Taxes (DGI), which ensures the collection of revenue and the application of tax laws. Dematerialization measures have been implemented to facilitate tax declarations and reduce administrative delays.

opportunities.title: Opportunities
opportunities.text: Cameroon offers numerous investment opportunities in various sectors, such as agriculture, energy, infrastructure, new technologies, etc.

regionalHarmonization.title: Regional Harmonization
regionalHarmonization.text: Membership in OHADA and CEMAC guarantees legal and fiscal uniformity with other countries in the region, which facilitates trade.

fiscalIncentives.title: Fiscal Incentives
fiscalIncentives.text: The numerous advantages provided by the Investment Code make Cameroon an attractive destination for investors.

legalStability.title: Legal Stability
legalStability.text: A structured and constantly improving legal framework.

cadre_juridique_fiscal.conclusionFinal: Cameroon has a robust legal and fiscal framework that combines modernity and tradition. Its laws and institutions aim to create a favorable environment for investment and economic development, while ensuring a certain stability. However, efforts are still needed to simplify administrative procedures, strengthen transparency, and further promote the country's attractiveness.
